title: 2023 Emergency Medicine Coding Guide
description: Rates the level of service required in emergency medicine based on 2023 AMA CPT Evaluation and Management (E/M) coding changes. Determines appropriate emergency department service level (99281-99285) based on medical decision making components.

parameters.name: number_complexity_problems
parameters.description: Number and complexity of problems addressed during the encounter
options: 3: 2 minor problems OR 1 stable chronic illness OR acute uncomplicated illness/injury OR stable acute illness OR uncomplicated illness requiring hospitalization
4: 2+ stable chronic illnesses OR undiagnosed new problem uncertain outcome OR acute illness with systemic symptoms OR acute complicated injury
5: chronic illness with severe exacerbation OR illness/injury with life or body threat

parameters.name: tests_ordered
parameters.description: Number of unique tests ordered (CBC, troponin, CT scan, EKG, etc.)

parameters.name: tests_reviewed
parameters.description: Number of test results reviewed (excluding labs) - imaging, EKGs, etc.

parameters.name: prior_notes_reviewed
parameters.description: Number of prior external notes reviewed (outside ED/hospital or specialty)

parameters.name: independent_historian
parameters.description: Assessment requiring independent historian (anyone providing additional information patient can't provide)

parameters.name: independent_interpretation
parameters.description: Independent interpretation of tests (test interpreted by ER doctor but formal read will be done by another HCP)

parameters.name: external_discussion
parameters.description: Discussed management/test interpretation with external professional

parameters.name: risk_level
parameters.description: Risk of morbidity, mortality, or complications

result.name: ed_service_level
result.description: Emergency Department service level and corresponding CPT code

ranges.interpretation: Emergency department visit that may not require the presence of a physician or other qualified health care professional. Straightforward medical decision making or no MDM required.
Emergency department visit requiring straightforward medical decision making. Simple, routine case with minimal complexity.
Emergency department visit requiring low level of medical decision making. Limited complexity with some data review or minimal risk.
Emergency department visit requiring moderate level of medical decision making. Moderate complexity with multiple problems, data analysis, or moderate risk.
Emergency department visit requiring high level of medical decision making. High complexity with extensive problems, significant data analysis, or high risk of complications.

2023 AMA CPT Evaluation and Management (E/M) coding changes for Emergency Medicine
MDCalc: 2023 Emergency Medicine Coding Guide. Available at: https://www.mdcalc.com/calc/10454/2023-emergency-medicine-coding-guide
formula: Based on Medical Decision Making (MDM) components: (1) Number and complexity of problems, (2) Amount/complexity of data reviewed, and (3) Risk of complications. Two of three elements must be met for each level.
notes: Reflects 2023 AMA CPT Evaluation and Management (E/M) coding changes
Time is not a factor in emergency department coding due to variable intensity
No distinction between new and established patients in ED
Two of three MDM elements must be met or exceeded for each level
Data elements can be combined (tests + notes + historian = combination)
Risk assessment is based on consequences when appropriately treated
